    "the @xmath2 @xmath3 cohomology ring of the borel construction @xmath18 is isomorphic to @xmath4 $ ] ; 2 .",
    "the inclusion @xmath19 induces a surjection in @xmath2 @xmath3 cohomology , and @xmath20 is isomorphic to the quotient @xmath4/(\\theta_1,\\ldots,\\theta_n)$ ] .",
    "moreover , with a further assumption that ( a1 ) @xmath0 is the boundary complex of a convex polytope , @xmath1 admits a canonical smooth structure to be a smooth @xmath17-manifold ( referred to as a _ real quasi - toric manifold _ ) , on which one can choose a morse function to give a cell structure so that a cell is a @xmath2 @xmath3 cycle as a cellular chain , and the total number of cells is precisely @xmath21 .",
    "however , their construction does not give an explicit basis for @xmath20 .",
    "go back to algebra , earlier works of kind and kleinschmidt @xcite and garsia @xcite showed that the ring @xmath4/(\\theta_1,\\ldots,\\theta_n)$ ] does admit a simple and explicit basis ( see proposition [ prop : basis ] ) , provided that @xmath0 is _",
    "shellable_. replaced by @xmath22 , for a _ quasi - toric manifold _ ; see remark [ rem : toric ] .",
    "] shellability is an important concept arising from combinatorics ; the assumption of shellability is well - known to be ( strictly ) stronger than ( a ) but weaker than ( a1 ) ( cf .",
    "@xcite ) .    in this paper",
    "we focus on the topological meaning of this basis to a small cover @xmath1 .",
    "we show that :    1 .",
    "a shelling of @xmath0 gives a cell structure on @xmath1 , such that a dual cell ( as a cellular cochain ) is a @xmath2 @xmath3 cocycle , and all dual cells give the basis above ; under ( a1 ) , this cell structure specializes to the one given in @xcite by a morse function .. ] 2 .   with integer coefficients ,",
    "the corresponding cellular cochain complex of @xmath1 is cochain - homotopy equivalent to a cochain complex @xmath23 , where @xmath24 is a direct sum of the cellular cochain complexes of a family of full subcomplexes of @xmath0 ( see theorem [ thm : main ] ) .",
    "means that the coefficients from coboundary operators are doubled : this explains why a dual cell of @xmath1 gives a @xmath2 @xmath3 cocycle .",
    "this family of full subcomplexes is due to suciu and trevisan @xcite in the description of the rational cohomology of a real quasi - toric manifold . ]    in this way we get all information of the cohomology groups @xmath25 ( see corollary [ cor : tor ] ) .",
    "in particular , we calculate explicitly the ( higher ) @xmath2 @xmath3 bockstein homomorphisms on @xmath20 ( see corollary [ cor : bss ] ) .",
    "buchstaber and ray @xcite showed that every unoriented cobordism class contains a real quasi - toric manifold ; it is well - known that the real part of a _ projective toric variety _",
    "( over @xmath26 ) is a real quasi - toric manifold .",
    "partial information of @xmath25 was obtained by trevisan @xcite , suciu and trevisan @xcite , and later by choi and park @xcite ( see corollary [ cor : tor ] ) .",
    "is a _ pullback of the linear model _",
    ", @xmath25 was given in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* corollary 6.11 ) ; see also yu @xcite and @xcite on stable decompositions of small covers . ]",
    "the paper is organized as follows .",
    "section [ sec:2 ] is a review of notations and previous results on small covers .",
    "the concept of shellability , and the induced filtrations on associated objects are given section [ sec : filtration ] .",
    "section [ sec:4 ] is a review of bockstein homomorphisms .",
    "the main theorem , theorem [ thm : main ] ( without proof ) , and its corollaries are given in section [ sec:5 ] .",
    "sections [ sec:6 ] and [ sec:7 ] are preparations to prove theorem [ thm : main ] ; the proof is given in section [ sec:8 ] , which is essentially ( again ) an induction based on a shelling . in section [ sec : fin ]",
    "we give examples to illustrate theorem [ thm : main ] .",

    "* theorem 5.10 ) , for any given integer @xmath326 , a @xmath327-torsion element can exist in the homology @xmath25 of a real quasi - toric manifold @xmath1 .",
    "this section is devoted to the construction of the cochain complex @xmath269 in theorem [ thm : main ] .",
    "an orientation of a @xmath150-cell @xmath328 in a @xmath329 complex @xmath153 is a chosen generator in @xmath330 , where @xmath331 is the topological boundary of @xmath328 .",
    "an oriented cell @xmath328 will be denoted by @xmath332 $ ] .",
    "let @xmath333 be the associated cellular chain complex , in which the boundary @xmath334 $ ] of an oriented @xmath150-cell is a @xmath22-linear sum of oriented @xmath335-cells .",
    "we omit the proof of the standard lemma below :    [ lem : cell ] suppose @xmath153 is a @xmath329 complex with an action of a finite group @xmath17 , such that @xmath336 then the cell structure of @xmath153 descends to that of the orbit space @xmath337 .",
    "the condition @xmath338 implies that each transformation @xmath339 is cellular , thus @xmath340 induces a chain map , namely if @xmath341=\\varepsilon [ ge]$ ] , then @xmath342=\\varepsilon \\partial[ge]$ ] , @xmath343 , where @xmath344 is induced by @xmath345 .",
    "let @xmath346 be the orbit map .",

    "we see that the cochain map @xmath273 induces a homomorphism between the long exact sequences associated to pairs @xmath678 and @xmath679 , respectively : @xmath219 \\obj(0,10)[aa]{$\\cdots\\leftarrow h^t(\\ol{c}^*_{\\lambda}(k_{j+1}),\\ol{d}^*_{j+1})$ } \\obj(28,10)[bb]{$ h^{t}(\\ol{c}^*_{\\lambda}(k_{j+1}))$ } \\obj(49,10)[cc]{$h^t(\\ol{d}^*_{j+1})\\leftarrow\\cdots$ }    \\obj(0,0)[dd]{$\\cdots\\leftarrow h^{t+1}(c^*(y_{j+1}),d^*_{j+1})$ }    \\obj(28,0)[ee]{$h^{t+1}(c^*(y_{j+1}))$ }    \\obj(49,0)[ff]{$h^{t+1}(d^*_{j+1})\\leftarrow\\cdots$ }    \\mor{bb}{aa}{}[+1,0 ]    \\mor{aa}{dd}{$\\phi$}[+1,0 ]    \\mor{cc}{bb}{}[+1,0 ]    \\mor{bb}{ee}{$\\phi$}[+1,0 ]    \\mor{ee}{dd}{}[+1,0 ]    \\mor{ff}{ee}{}[+1,0 ]    \\mor{cc}{ff}{$\\phi$}[+1,0 ] \\enddc",
    "\\label{eq : gg}\\ ] ] where by induction hypothesis , for any @xmath680 , the first column is an isomorphism ; in ( c ) of proposition [ prop : key2 ] , @xmath579 of vanishes since @xmath666^*=[\\sigma_{j+1}\\cap\\omega_{j+1}]^*$ ] is the last dual simplex in @xmath681 , hence the image of @xmath666^*$ ] under @xmath273 is exactly , which means that the third column is also an isomorphism ( which is non - trivial only when @xmath682 ) .",
    "therefore , the middle column is an isomorphsim , from which ( a ) holds . by proposition [ prop : djsta ] , as vector spaces , @xmath683 is obtained from @xmath213 by adding a basis element @xmath684 $ ] , which has to be the @xmath2 @xmath3 reduction of .",
    "we see that holds , and the whole proof is completed by induction .",
    "in this section , a simplex @xmath685 will be denoted by @xmath686 for short .",
    "first consider example [ exm : kb ] again .",

    "we can choose @xmath261 $ ] , @xmath717 $ ] , @xmath718 $ ] and @xmath719 $ ] as a basis for @xmath720 ( since @xmath721 is torsion - free , for all @xmath278 ) ; other six basis elements in @xmath20 are connected in pairs by @xmath225 . as a conclusion , @xmath722",
    "when @xmath0 is shellable in the sense of bjrner and wachs @xcite ( i.e. , @xmath0 need not to be pure ) , the algebraic basis from shellability ( cf .",
    "proposition [ prop : basis ] ) still holds ( see ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 12.3 ) ) , and our proof of theorem [ thm : main ] works as well .",
    "shellable complexes ( in the usual sense ) are considered in this paper since we are interested in the case when the small cover is a piecewise linear manifold ( see proposition [ prop : dec ] ) .",
    "99 a. bjorner and m. wachs , _ shellable nonpure complexes and posets .",
    "i _ , trans .",
    "* 348 * ( 1996 ) , 12991327 .",

    "ii _ , trans .",
    "* 349 * ( 1997 ) , 39453975 .",

    "* 347 * , surveys in contemporary mathematics , cambridge ( 2008 ) , 165201 ; arxiv : math.at/0506526 .",
    "a.  trevisan , _ generalized davis - januszkiewicz spaces and their applications in algebra and topology _ , ph.d .",
    "thesis , vrije university amsterdam , 2012 ; available at http://dspace.ubvu.vu.nl/handle/1871/32835 ."

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> from a given shelling of a simplicial complex @xmath0 , we get a cell decomposition for a small cover @xmath1 associated to @xmath0 , which is a generalization of the one given in davis and januszkiewicz @xcite by a morse function </S>",
    "<S> . then we study its relation with the well - known algebraic decomposition of the @xmath2 @xmath3 stanley - reisner ring @xmath4 $ ] from the shelling . </S>",
    "<S> in particular we calculate the cohomology groups of @xmath1 with integer coefficients .    </S>",
    "<S> [ section ] [ thm]corollary [ thm]lemma [ thm]proposition    [ thm]definition [ thm]notation    [ thm]example [ thm]remark </S>"
  ]
}
